content: * 6 stalk bend the ends of the wire and use a light-weight 2-7 slip_stitch 6 row yarn to wrap and bind the pipe cleaner 8 kfb knit 7 begin to close the seam using mattress stitch working 9 purl up toward the cap stuff the bottom of the stalk and insert the wrapped pipe cleaner so that it extends just 10 k3 kfb k3 8 past the stalk into the cap portion continue seaming 11-15 slip_stitch 5 row stuffing the upper portion of the stalk very lightly if at all 16 kfb k3 * 10 17-19 slip_stitch 3 row when you reach the cap underside switch yarn color and continue to stitch the seam closed proceed to sew 20 k2 kfb k2 * 12 along the topside of the cap stuffing lightly when you 21 purl reach the cast-on stitches weave through them and pull to tighten and close 22 k2tog * 6 © 2019 tatyana grigoryan 2 the following sculpting step is indispensable in reinforcing a more naturally shaped form you will be using your threaded embroidery needle to create a series of loose stitches connecting the topside and underside of the cap you may use the cap topside color thread or a lighter weight thread to execute this portion pierce the threaded needle into the rough top-center of the cap and drive it so that it emerges at a point where the stalk and cap underside meet repeat this step in reverse aiming to push the needle through at a slight angle and as close as possible to the point where the thread emerged from the previous stitch do not pull too tightly so that the shape retains its integrity repeat these steps several times working to stitch along the total circumference of the stalk so that the topside and underside are sufficiently anchored to each other for an even more realistic appearance repeat this sculpting process of stitching back and forth between underside and topside closer to the edge of the cap where the the two colors meet very lightly pinching the area along the cap circumference weave in ends you re done enjoy your mushroom © 2019 tatyana grigoryan 3
